alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:19AM EST until February 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by an ice jam is expected, particularly over/near the Canajoharie Creek. * WHERE...A portion of eastern New York, including the following county, Montgomery. This is particularly the case around/near the Canajoharie Creek. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 AM EST, Satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate an ice jam due to Localized minor flooding reported as well as the possibility of an ice jam over the Canajoharie Creek. Flooding is already occurring. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - 911 Call Center reported some minor localized flooding in the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canajoharie, Fort Plain, St. Johnsville, Ames, Palatine Bridge, Nelliston, Cook Corners, McKinley, Sprakers, Stone Arabia, East Stone Arabia, Christmans Corners, Mapletown, Marshville, Flat Creek, Yosts, Sand Hill, Currytown, Randall and Root Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email atALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany. Ice jams are unpredictable. River levels may fluctuate rapidly at any time. Forecast values represent ice-free flow.
